About.Name: Luca Benoit
About.AboutText:
Hi, I am Luca Benoit. I am a passionate electrical engineering student with a keen interest in sustainable energy alternatives. Currently, I am pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University. I am dedicated to expanding my knowledge and skills in various areas of electrical engineering, with a particular focus on power systems.

I enjoy tackling challenging projects and I thrive in collaborative environments where I can contribute my expertise and learn from my peers.

I believe in the importance of continuous learning and seek out opportunities to explore new technologies and methodologies.

Project1.Title: Frequency Detection Design Project
Project1.Desc:
The goal of this project was to design a system that transmits and receives three audio frequency signal transmitted and received via modulation on infrared (IR) signals to turn on an LED at a specific frequency. Any combination of these three frequencies (10 kHz, 17 kHz, and 25 kHz) may be on at a given time.

The screenshots illustrates the design process:

1. Designing the filter in Multisim.

2. Bode Plot of the filter.

3. Frequency Response Analysis of the physical circuit.

4. Filter Output (All three frequencies on).

5. Filter Output (Only stopping frequencies, 10 and 25 kHz)

6. Filter with Peak Detector.

7. Peak detector output (All three frequencies).

8. Peak detector output (Only stopping frequencies).
